page.title: 11Moorhill Day Centre
page.content: { Moorhill Day Centre}has between 24 and 36 adult clients at a time. This centre and the adjoining residential hostel which can accomodate 19 residents, form a complete unit for the rehabilitation of the mentally ill. Life here is intended to prepare clients for independent living, by training them to manage to live alone, or in a group. Most clients living in a hostel accomodation have first attended the day centre before being admitted. This is necessary because once living in the hostel they must be able to provide their own meals, do their own laundry, and budget their own money. Cooking, home management, woodwork, gardening, general arts and crafts and social activities are included in the programme.
